results.title: Boy to man
results.brief_description: Indicates the changes in a boy’s body at adolescence in growth, skin, and voice , and illustrates by diagrams the male and female reproductive organs.

results.brief_description: A complete description of the Boy Scout Movement, illustrating its growth and the activities of the boys in all parts of the world.

results.title: A Boy of the Netherlands
results.brief_description: The experiences of a Dutch farm boy when he travels by cargo barge to Amsterdam along the canals of Holland. He learns about life on board ship; and something of the industries of his country. The highlight of his visit to Amsterdam is a tour of city shops. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: A Boy of the Navajos
results.brief_description: This is the story of Tony Hotinez a present-day Navajo boy. It recounts his adventures as he herds sheep in the Arizona desert, spends evenings with his family in their hogan, and takes an exciting trip to the trading post, where Tony sells the drawings of the Navajos and of their customs which he has made. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: A Boy of the circus
results.brief_description: Dino, the only one of his family not employed at the circus, visits an opening performance to try to interest them in giving him a job. We see how circus people work together to produce a spectacle in which Dino finally plays a part.

results.title: A Boy of India: Rama and his elephant
results.brief_description: This is the story of Rama, an eight-year-old boy who lives with his family on a tea plantation in Assam, India. The story tells of a very special day in Rama’s life. Accompanying his father, a mahout, to learn how he handles his work elephant, Rama for the first time works with the elephant Gunda as she pulls a stalled tea truck from the stream. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Boy next door
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A story of two children for whom a difference in language made no difference once the first moves were made. When French-speaking Jacques moves next door to English-speaking Jimmy, each is amazed to find that the other doesn’t speak his language. But when it comes to exploring, playing together, language just doesn’t seem to matter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ernest Reid, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Boy meets band
results.creator_credit: David Bennett, Nicholas Balla, Tim Wilson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: They are only pint-size musicians but they make peppy music. The West Vancouver Boys’ Band (there are girls in it too), prizewinners at band festivals in Canada and Europe, set feet tapping in this film as they rehearse for a local gala event. Follows a new recruit, to show the full scope of musical opportunity given to youngsters in Vancouver through joint community effort.

results.title: Boy in the garden
results.brief_description: The enchantment to be found in a bush-like garden by a young boy who reflects the spirit shown in the statue of Pan playing his pipes. Scampering, dabbling his toes, floating flower petals and pressing his face close to the flowers, he shows us his fascination in the wonder of nature. A film without commentary and with flute accompaniment. Music: Nancy Tow.

results.title: The Boy and the pelican
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Gurnan, Arden Winch and Wessex Film Productions
results.brief_description: Pedro a pampered pelican lives happily on a Greek island until the arrival of a small boy called Hiko. Pedro is then forgotten by the islanders. He tries to fly away but is too bloated to succeed. On his return Pedro is seen by Niko who falls in love with him. Pedro is now completely happy.
